website_summaries.verdict: Uses a blend of natural herbs to assist with safe and easy hairball digestion.
pros: Contains a mix of natural herbs that assist with smooth hairball digestion
Tablets are chewable and can be easily divided into smaller pieces
Can be mixed into food, or given as a “treat”
Sits at a quality price point
cons: When split in half or crushed, tablets have a strong scent

customer_reviews.title: New Formula Takes Out Chicken and Liver, adds Paper and Sand
customer_reviews.text: I have had this item on subscribe and save for some time and opened a new bottle tonight. I immediately felt a difference in the thickness of the tablet and it felt lighter. Broke in half easier. My cat, who absolutely loved the old formula, sniffed and licked the new tablet and then batted it away, rejecting it. I compared the ingredients to discover chicken and liver were replaced by cellulose (used to make paper) and silicon dioxide (sand). Obviously a cost cutting measure resulting in an inferior product. I've cancelled my subscribe and save order. Picture shows old bottle ingredients (right side) to new (left side).
customer_reviews.author: Anthony DiGiovanni

customer_reviews.title: The formula CHANGED, darn it!!
customer_reviews.text: Used to be a 5 star item. But the formula changed in Spring 2016. The tablets I bought in April 2016 were not appealing to my cats anymore. They used to scarf them up and REALLY helped with digestion and hairballs. NOT ANYMORE. Cats won't eat them. The company refunded my money, but I am very upset that the good formulation is no longer available. I can only hope that enough consumer input will cause the company making these (The Brampton Company) to go back to the previous effective and yummy formula. I include a photo of the old label and the new.
customer_reviews.author: girl with cats

customer_reviews.title: This used to be a really great remedy for hairballs.
customer_reviews.text: For the past three years, this furball pill has been a welcomed daily treat for my four cats. Now, they won't touch this product. I am removing Vet's Best Hairball Relief from my Amazon Subscribe & Save list, tonight. And four full bottles are going in the trash. This used to be a really great remedy for hairballs.
customer_reviews.author: smcwilcox

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE SAME PRODUCT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The product was changed, the pill is in a different shape and my cat, who used to love this pill and beg me for it, now refuses to eat it. Now I have to find a different way to solve the hairball problem. Waah!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth getting!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t care for the scent and my cat won’t eat the tablets. I grind them up in my food processor. Then I mix it in with my cats soft food both morning and evening. In the past year or so that I have given it to my cat (a long hair Maine coon) he hasn’t coughed up a hairball even once. Not to say that he doesn’t vomit, but it’s not a hairball! 😊
customer_reviews.author: Gram Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Used to love it now I am sad.  :(
customer_reviews.text: Used to love it now I am sad. Formula change and now my cats that treated it as a daily treat now wont even look at it. I was on the Subscribe plan and had to cancel it after two bottles that my 3 cats wont touch. cost cutting isn't worth unhappy customers.
customer_reviews.author: Clare L. Walters

customer_reviews.title: Formula changed -- Now too hard for a cat to eat
customer_reviews.text: I've been purchasing these for my cat for several months, and they work pretty well. However, the last bottle that arrived must have been made using a new formula. Instead of the chalky, soft pills that were easy to break in half, the pills are now glossy, rock solid, and impossible to break in half -- much less for a cat to be able to chew (because they are very large, like almost the size of a quarter and thick). There is no option on my account to contact the seller for a refund of the last bottle.
customer_reviews.author: DMG

customer_reviews.title: No more, the Cat has final say.
customer_reviews.text: I had been giving this to my cat for years, but since my last order in May he says "No way mama, it stinks and is gross". He was always good, he would eat it right up and actually looked forward to it like a snack. Then he wouldn't have anything to do with it, I even crushed it and put it in his wet food (if he ate the food he would vomit it back up). So I will be throwing out several bottles and will resort to the gel stuff, it was so much easier with these pills. Oh well, life is about changes.
customer_reviews.author: Reb

customer_reviews.title: Horrible new formula the Chicken & Liver in this product replaced with cellulose (used to make paper) & silicon dioxide (sand)
customer_reviews.text: Would give this a zero stars if it was an option - I have been giving this to my cats for years and they always loved it - Now they wont touch it. After some investigation i found out why - The company changed the formula - The chicken and liver have been replaced by cellulose (used to make paper) and silicon dioxide (sand). Horrible company there is Absolutely no excuse for putting cellulose and sand instead of Chicken and Liver in a pet product.
customer_reviews.author: Snow

customer_reviews.title: Terribly Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this product for a long time and my cats loved it. The new bottle I received they both turned their noses up and walked away. After reading the reviews here on Amazon, I read the ingredient list and noted the changes. I no longer will purchase this product as well as many others who are also disappointed. I'm afraid you will be losing a great deal of money and customers over this change in formula. Go back to the way it was-the cats loved it and benefited by it. Now you are helping no one.
customer_reviews.author: patti gallagher

customer_reviews.title: ... this product for over a year and my cat loved them. Recently received new order and cat will ...
customer_reviews.text: Had been using this product for over a year and my cat loved them. Recently received new order and cat will not touch them. Label on bottle is different, packaging is different and I assume formula is different. Opened bottle of previous order and cat ate it right up. I assume they also changed the formula. Am extremely disappointed with this product and will not buy anymore of this item. UPDATE: Switched to Purina One Hairball Formula cat food. My cat loves it! Removes need for separate hairball treatment and have not had any issues related to hairballs. Vet's Best can take their product and..., well , you know.
customer_reviews.author: Don S

customer_reviews.title: My cats hate the new formula
customer_reviews.text: Up until now, I had used this product successfully for our cats, but that has changed with the new formula. It’s terrible. It is no longer helping to control the hairballs, and my cats dislike it—they won’t eat if I put it in their food. They used to love it. Very disappointed. Going to have to look for a new product.
customer_reviews.author: Sandshil

customer_reviews.title: Use a hammer
customer_reviews.text: Update: I went back and read reviews, and found a phone number for the company Hero Brands....this morning is the third time I called, and don't bother. I was left on hold every time I tried to call. Such a shame...these products were awesome back in the day. I have given these to my cat before...sometimes they are easy to break up (and you have to break them up), sometimes not as easy. The bottle I recently purchased is the worst yet!! Honestly, I cut my finger trying to break it. I used a baggie and a bottle and banged it....it didn't even break then. :) Horrible. I will be returning
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: He used to LOVE, LOVE, LOVE now HATES the new formula.
customer_reviews.text: My 13-year-old tabby male kitty loved the old formula, it was his favorite treat first thing in the morning and last thing at night, but now he is completely uninterested. I purchased this as part of S & S in a previous month and was finishing up an old bottle until recently. CUSTOMERS NEED TO KNOW THERE IS A CHANGE IN FORMULA BEFORE BLINDLY springing it on us. I apparently missed the return window so in this case, throwing it away negates the whole subscribe & "save" concept. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: PenName

customer_reviews.title: My cats used to love this stuff and it was a life saver during ...
customer_reviews.text: Formula has changed...now my cats won't touch it! My cats used to love this stuff and it was a life saver during hair shedding season, as well as helping my one cat with her irritable bowel symptoms. All I had to do was grab the bottle and they would come running! Now they won't touch it. The new ingredients are actually harmful...I wasted my money...in the trash they go! I don't understand why they changed the ingredients!!
customer_reviews.author: Suzy Homemaker

customer_reviews.title: First bottle great; second bottle no good
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar experience as some other reviewers. The first bottle I received a few months ago contained the hard pills that were difficult to break, but I didn't mind because my cat loved them and they really made a difference as to how infrequent he brought up hairballs. I was happy that when I received the second bottle, the pills were much easier to break apart. But my cat only ate a few and then stopped eating them. I didn't compare ingredients as some reviewers did, but I threw out the second bottle and now have to find something new for him.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Possibly changed ingredients/formula
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product successfully before. This time it appears they changed the label to say "Hairball Relief/Digestive Aid." The pills appear to be softer and thinner. My two cats, who loved this product previously, won't touch these new pills. I surmise that the formula/ingredients have been altered. So much for buying in bulk. I guess the raccoons and opossums will like them.
customer_reviews.author: Sendai Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Been using for 7 years now and even after formula change.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it appears that the company did change the formula but they're still effective. Before the formula change, I could give these tablets to the cats and they would be able to eat them. After the formula change the tablets are much more firm and the cats don't even try to chew them so I've gotten a pill crusher to do the job and pulverize the tablet and then mix it into the cats' food instead of giving it to them directly.
customer_reviews.author: Gunner76

customer_reviews.title: Works, but the pills are rock hard now
customer_reviews.text: We've been giving our cat Vet's Best Hairball Relief Formula for about five years. It has definitely made a difference. He still throws up a hairball sporadically but not nearly like he used to (daily). I break it apart and sprinkle it over his wet food and he gobbles it down. I wish that Vet's Best would find a consistency to the density/hardness of the product though. I used to be able to use my fingers to break and crumble the pills, then they would sometimes be so hard that I couldn't do it; now, they are consistently so hard that I have to use a mortar and pestle and hammer it before I can finish grinding it up.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Why!!! Did you change them?
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat who suffers from hairball issues and these pills were helping to keep it under control. That is until you change the flavor. Now even if I mix it in with wet food she will find it and refused to eat it. I don’t know if this change was an effort to cut cost or if there was another reason behind it but it has sadly taken a great product and just throw it in the trash. Reading the reviews it looks like I am not the only one who is having this problem. From myself and many others out here we beg you to bring back the original formula.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin 805

customer_reviews.title: Sad cat, bring back the good stuff!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat used to LOVE this stuff. Something changed. He hates the new formula! He runs to his bowl, tries to eat the product and spits it out. Makes me so sad! He used to go crazy for this every morning not so much anymore. I wonder what changed, please change it back ASAP! I have a very sad cat until then :(
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: It has helped a lot
customer_reviews.text: Works but if you got a picky eater you may have to crumble the tablet on its food. The pill has a mild smell to it but I guess the kitties like it. The ones I received were not hard like some of the reviewers said. The tablets crumbles down to powder with my fingers so it’s pretty easy to give it to the kitties. Have the hair all’s stopped? Well no but I have seen my cat hacking them up way less than before.
customer_reviews.author: Armin the Copy Kat

customer_reviews.title: My cat HATED it
customer_reviews.text: Well they are definitely too big for any normal sized house cat to eat.. They don’t smell or (apparently) taste good since my cat literally REFUSED to eat it. I tried hiding smaller pieces in treats, wet food, and I even ground it up and tried sprinkling it on his food but he would either refuse the whole set up entirely or eat around it. I finally resorted to hand feeding him small pieces as if it were medication and he was able to cough every piece up. Complete waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlynne

customer_reviews.title: Helps in Hairball Prevention
customer_reviews.text: Vet's Best Hairball Relief Digestive Aid is great for all cats who are plagued with hairball problems. Each bottle comes with sixty tablets inside which are rather large but can be easily broken into smaller pieces. I break the pieces into fourths for my furbabies. The instructions indicate to give one tablet twice daily. I would say that I have about an 80% likability rate from my cats to this product. Most like it and gobble it down with no problem (when broken into four pieces). It is not 100% effective in my opinion but I have yet to find something that is. It is just another tool in the toolbox for me.
customer_reviews.author: ❤️AlleyCat❤️

customer_reviews.title: misleading
customer_reviews.text: this is in the description-"PETROLEUM FREE - Now comes in 2 pack of 60 chewable tablets each free of petroleum-based hairball relief ingredients. Easy to break into smaller pieces. Made in the USA." Which i read as a two pack. the one pack of two items.
customer_reviews.author: Indy

customer_reviews.title: Best Natural and Affordable Hairball Remedy
customer_reviews.text: I love that my cats will actually eat these! They are picky and don’t like the hair ball gels, and I don’t like most of the ingredients in gel hair ball removers or other hair ball treats. I care about the ingredients first and next if it works or not. They love to eat these. This is the best natural and affordable hairball remedy I have found. If I skip a day from hairball remedy... usually there will be a mess to clean up. I have two long hair RagDoll kitties, lots of hair. One pill a day keeps the vomit away.
customer_reviews.author: Freya

customer_reviews.title: WHY???
customer_reviews.text: Why change an excellent product? The chicken (dried) has been removed, cellulose and silicon dioxide have been added. Why does cellulose, which is a cheap filler, need to be added? I have been using this hairball product for several years with excellent results. These new tablets are horrible...and the price has increased!? I will be looking for a new hairball relief aid. What a shame they had to ruin a good thing. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Karyn P

customer_reviews.title: Used to work and cats loved them, but they changed formula
customer_reviews.text: Our cats used to LOVE these (to a ridiculous degree). They couldn't get enough. I noticed the label changed, but apparently the formula changed to. The cats just licked them and then spit them out. I tried breaking them up in little pieces and put them in their food bowl, and they ate around them. I just tried to give it to them again and they wouldn't even lick them anymore. I don't know what they changed, but it must have been a crucial ingredient. :(
customer_reviews.author: H. Chapin

customer_reviews.title: Cats won't eat it
customer_reviews.text: Had hoped to make this a regular part of my cat's treatment to keep hairballs at a minimum, but they won't eat the food I put it in. I grind the pills into a powder (individually) and add one to each of their meals. NO GO! They won't touch anything I add it to. Defeats the purpose and is a waste of money for me. Cats do have very individual reactions to food and medications, so it may work wonderfully well for you and your fur baby, but it didn't for me and mine.
customer_reviews.author: Avalon100

customer_reviews.title: Recent change = Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: These pills were our kitties MOST favorite "treat" before bedtime - they would literarily come running from anywhere in the house after hearing only one shake of the bottle. They won't eat any from the last batch received...at first we thought maybe it was a truck delivery issue (the weather being so hot, moisture in the bottle), so we went and picked up a bottle from the pet store this weekend....but still no luck. We are so disappointed and so are our kitties. We beg you - please go back to the old formula!!
customer_reviews.author: A. Land

customer_reviews.title: My cat and I love these pills
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves the flavor and looks forward to it everyday. He has no trouble chewing it. I usually give with dinner and breakfast. I feel they have been working though I use it more as a preventative as he coughs and never has the hairball. 100% recommend. Great quality and packaging. Easy to store and easy to hide from cats that steal treats!
customer_reviews.author: Jen Gambuti

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with the change....cats are, too!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 cats LOVED these treats for years and they worked great! But now, they are not working at all. With the new formula, my cats will at least eat them now.....but they're not effective anymore. I'm cleaning up hairballs like never before. With the old formulation, the hairballs were almost non-existent! It was great! I thought I had finally found something that worked. I am now looking for a better hairball product. If anyone has found anything that works, please let me know! Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: they have changed the formula and the cats won't touch ...
customer_reviews.text: they have changed the formula and the cats won't touch them. they promised they would send a replacement bottle with a new formula. that was over a month ago. nothing is being done. phone calls not helping either...
customer_reviews.author: RER

customer_reviews.title: Lond haired kitty left hair balls every day until we started this product.  Not any more!
customer_reviews.text: Our kitty loves the taste of this product and comes running every time I shake the bottle. They think it's a treat. She no longer spits up hair balls everyday. I do brush her every day in addition to this product and this in addition to the product has the hair ball issue virtually gone.
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: Loved them because my cat loved to eat them but ...
customer_reviews.text: In the past, I had a love/hate relationship with these things. Loved them because my cat loved to eat them but hated them because some were impossible to break apart by hand. I still have that love/hate relationship but it is reversed now. Something has changed.... They aren't as thick and are much easier to break apart. *thumbs up* But now my cat won't even touch them. He sniffs at the pieces and walks away, yet keeps begging. Kinda feel bad for the poor fellow. So, from my cat to your company, he gives you the "paw" (since he doesn't have any middle fingers). Not a happy household with this product anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Justine Brossart

customer_reviews.title: Both my cats and I loved the first bottle of Vet's Best that I purchased
customer_reviews.text: Both my cats and I loved the first bottle of Vet's Best that I purchased. They eagerly awaited it when they saw me pick up the bottle and I loved the fact it took care of their hairballs. The second bottle I bought was entirely another matter. The formula was changed (chicken eliminated was what I noticed) and they wanted nothing to do with this version. They sniffed it and walked away. If the company changed back to their original formula, I would buy it again. Until then, I will not be purchasing it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jane R

customer_reviews.title: My cat never has hairballs
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it's definitely because of this product, but I have been giving this to my cat, Tigerlily, since she was a kitten. She is now a little over 2 years old. I have never seen her throw up a hairball. I wish my other 3 cats would like these as well, but she is the only one who seems to like these. When she was a kitten, I started breaking up the tablet into 4 pieces. I continue to do that. The label says twice a day, but I only give her one per day. And, Amazon has the best price for this product!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie J. Barnard

customer_reviews.title: This was a five star until formula was changed,  will re evaluate once sample is received.
customer_reviews.text: This was great until formula was changed and the chicken flavor was removed. My cat will not touch it. Called manufacturer and they are redoing formula due to many complaints. They are offering a refnd and sending a sample of new formula. What else can you ask for? Great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Poly

customer_reviews.title: Made of CONCRETE???
customer_reviews.text: What's up with the big, thick tablet? These used to be more like wafers and were easy to break apart and mix in with the food. They changed it and now I have to hammer it with a meat pounder in order to get it to crumble into smaller pieces--yet the directions still say to simply "break apart". There is no simply about it. I have arthritis in both thumbs and even if I didn't, I would not be able to break them up with my hands. Bramton really made a big mistake here and I will not order these again, even though I have been using them for quite some time now. NO MORE!
customer_reviews.author: Lisanne757

customer_reviews.title: Hairball Tablets to the rescue
customer_reviews.text: My cat over grooms and was suffering from hairballs almost daily. It was really difficult for her until we got her this. We feed her one tablet in the morning and she loves it! It's easy for her to chew and she loves the taste. It's like a little treat!
customer_reviews.author: goldenwolves

customer_reviews.title: Worked wonders
customer_reviews.text: My 16-year old long-haired cat was throwing up daily and getting badly constipated. I bought these pills and within a week he was doing much better. The puking is down to once a week and he's pooping daily. I do have to crush them and mix it in his canned food as he won't eat them as a treat. I tried breaking them off into sections as recommended and offering it to him but he didn't fall for that. Still, worth the extra effort to keep him healthy.
customer_reviews.author: ms_skye

customer_reviews.title: Long term benefits
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an immediate hairball relief product, this is not for you. However, given daily it prevents them. I've been using one broken tab every day for over a month now. My cat preffers it broken and mixed with a few dried treats. The only time my cat has even hacked a little was when I neglected to give him the tab 3 days in a row. I had to use another solution to solve that hairball, but once I continued the tabs daily all was good.
customer_reviews.author: HoneySuckle

customer_reviews.title: My gorgeous long-haired Snowshoe/Siamese/Ragdoll cat that I adopted from a ...
customer_reviews.text: My gorgeous long-haired Snowshoe/Siamese/Ragdoll cat that I adopted from a shelter spends an inordinate amount of time grooming herself. I, however, do not spend nearly as much time combing her. Consequently, she developed a furball that became stuck in the opening of her small intestine. Thousands of dollars later, I have a healthy cat, due in some part to these little pills. I pulverize one each morning with a "muddler" and incorporate it into her Fussie Cat canned food. I also alternate incorporating Tomlyn Hairball Remedy and Nordic Natural Pet Omega-3 at night. Sprinkle some kibble over the top and she will eat every bite.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Best Hairball Product Ever
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased hairball remedies from everywhere, even directly from my Vet's office, but I had to sit on my cat to get them to accept every one until I found this product. Now, instead of chasing the cat, the cat chases me when he here's me pick-up the bottle. We have two cats, and both just love these pills. You can break the pill up into quarters or just give it to your cat whole, whichever way the cat prefers. I use it as a treat and it has really helped. I don't normally recommend producst, but this one is really great.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Kendrick

customer_reviews.title: Cats love these!
customer_reviews.text: Both of my cats run from whereu they are when I open the bottle to give them these. One is extremely picky, and even he never hesitated once (I was stunned since he rejects most treats and food!). I love the slippery elm in these, and will give it to them as long as necessary. Not sure as they help with hairballs, as I also use other measures (egg yolk and MCT oil) but I'm sure it can't hurt with these ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: BARBARA B.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these, I was worried he wouldn't have any interest in them since they seem kind of chalky, but he begs me for them. As far as hairball control it seems to be helping. He used to spit up hairballs at LEAST 2-3 times a week. Since we've recently moved I was trying to save our new carpets (he's not polite enough to spit up on the hardwood) it's been two weeks and no hairballs so far (knock on wood) But I've also been religious abt giving them morning and night. I'll update review once we've been using them longer but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Too large for cat to swallow
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my cat doest like the flavor so i have to force her to take the pill, it has to be break at least 4 pieces in order to make them swallow otherwise they spit it out. hopefully it has more flavor choice so that i can finde one that my cat willing to take.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: MAGIC that went down hill
customer_reviews.text: Original review: This stuff is amazing. My cat went from having hair balls 2-3 times per week to maybe one time per month at most (as long as I remember to give these to her regularly). I have tried so many different hair ball remedies and this is the only one that seems to work Updated review 3-6-19: something changed in this formula. These tablets are nearly impossible to break apart now whereas before they broke with ease. I can’t continue to purchase if I can barely break these apart.
customer_reviews.author: Laine Coplin

customer_reviews.title: This is a cat product written by a human...
customer_reviews.text: My cat has lots of hair, that pile of white hair is that cat I am writing about. I do not know about the flavor, or the ability of the hairball cleanup because I usually walk on the hairballs. She produces a lot of hairballs and we try everything that comes down the pike, across the Internet or is mentioned on Jackson Galaxy. She hurls something every.single.day.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Jaccard

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves The old formula
customer_reviews.text: My cat love the old formula. She does not care for this new formula I've been looking for the old one and cannot find it. Hoping you bring the old one back. The picture that I added is the old formula bottle. I read the ingredients for both of them they are the same. Something must be different because my cat loves the other one and not this one . So I found the other one and order that and I'm hoping my cat loves it the same.
customer_reviews.author: Roya Rahim

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had worked better
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my cat is very sensitive to the ingredients which gave him a very soft stool He also was not interested in eating them so I would cut them up, crush them in a pill crusher and sprinkle it on his dry food. He was fine with this arrangement but I discontinued due to soft stool
customer_reviews.author: Marilee Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: like others, used to love this product
customer_reviews.text: My cat, like others, used to love this product. They used to be hard to break up, but I got a pill cutter, and that solved the problem. With the new formulation and thinner, easier to break up product, my cat hates it and will eat it only if he's very hungry. Bring back the old formula, please.
customer_reviews.author: Maine Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inconvient to feed
customer_reviews.text: Such a pain to crush up. I hate these. They're huge you can't just leave one in whole, can't crush it easily and the pieces look jagged and huge. I don't get why they are so hard and I'm supposed to do it twice? It should come with an XL pill crusher.
customer_reviews.author: Nasha

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend Trying
customer_reviews.text: My kitty is a senior with a sensitive stomach and a picky palate. He still does occasionally have some incidents, but he has some other issues on top of his long fur. This has far reduced the frequency of hairballs and also stomach irritation related to hairballs. And, he actually likes it! Obviously tastes vary kitty to kitty, but my picky boy loves these. They are crumbly and easy to break texture-wise. There is a lot of dust in the bottle for it though.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Really helps with digesting the hair!
customer_reviews.text: My cat would throw up every single day after she ate her food, after these she’s not thrown up once unless I forget to give this to her. I smash it up and put it in her food when I feed her. Has been a HUGE help. This helps her digest the fur in her system so she can eat without puking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Marginally useful after changing recipe
customer_reviews.text: The recipe changed some years ago, but I still use this. It seems to help, but not as well as it did when I started using it in 2011.
customer_reviews.author: Annazon

customer_reviews.title: It works for my CatsF!!!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to help my cats. My cat Braveheart often seemed to be gagging. Made me feel bad but didn't know what to do. Tried the petroleum based hairball remedies but my cats balked and tried to run away when I gave it to them and mostly it bothered me to have them ingest a petroleum product. Tried this and it is a tiny bit of a pain, since neither cat will just eat it unless I crush it and add to moist food of they don;t eat. But it is worth the little extra work for my boys. Prince is doing well on it and No more gagging from Braveheart!
customer_reviews.author: Pat F

customer_reviews.title: My cats love these as treats.
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don’t know if these help cats with hairballs because my two guys who eat them do not have hairball issues. I had bought them for another cat but these two fell in love with them. It’s strange that they get so incredibly excited for round tablets but there’s something really appealing about them. I can understand why other cats might not care for them and would suggest crushing or crumbling them and mixing with something strongly scented/appealing to get them to consume them.
customer_reviews.author: M Fox

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't help with hairballs
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this as my long haired cat gets hairballs pretty frequently. It arrived May 1st & I started it that night. My cat LOVED the flavor. BUT in the last 7 days (& today is May 19th) my cat has vomited a hairball 3 different days. This is actually more hairballs than he typically vomits up in a month. Will not be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda B

customer_reviews.title: Helped my cat!
customer_reviews.text: 8 months ago my cat (10 year old tabby) had surgery for a hairball obstruction. He has been doing well and I have been giving him a regular hairball paste, but he started vomiting his dry food again and I knew he was developing another obstruction. After reading the reviews on this product, I decided to give it a try and I am very happy I did. My cat is back to being regular after just a few days of 2 tablets a day broken up in his wet food. Thank you for this quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Webb

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves them and I love a clean carpet
customer_reviews.text: Gone through two bottle of this with my long hair cat who has a history of hairball problems. Recently ran out for two days and for the first time since I’ve found this product, came home to hairball and cat vomit on my floor. Will not be running out again. 10/10 works great and my cat absolutely loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Frels

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE FORMULA CHANGE, NOW WORTHLESS
customer_reviews.text: Like some of the others, I purchased 2 bottles the first time and it worked great, my kitty loved the taste. This last time, thankfully I only ordered one bottle, and my little hasn't eaten the first one! The smell is horrible. I will NOT be buying more. Why change something that is working so well??? Now I have a bottle that is useless. And your formula change cost me the price of this bottle of pills. So very disappointed! Please go back to the original!
customer_reviews.author: ibjoy1953

customer_reviews.title: They had an amazing product and ruined it for profit.
customer_reviews.text: I used t o buy this by the case because my cats LOVED IT!! All I had to do was shake the bottle and say "treats" and they came running. Now I will have to find something else because I won't order it after they changed the formula. Not happy with the new ingredients. Hope they change it back. Until then I will look into finding another product to take it's place.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa J Pursell

customer_reviews.title: They were great, easy to give to them
customer_reviews.text: Our cats used to go crazy over these. They were great, easy to give to them, a nice treat that made them feel special, and helped with their digestion. They had less hairballs and were better with their food. We used to buy 3 bottles a month. They changed the formula/format of these twice, and the latest ones the cats do not like. I wish I could return all the unopened bottles. It is such a shame! I still haven't found a treat, but have resorted to putting the powder in their food.
customer_reviews.author: MsDove

customer_reviews.title: My cat used to love these.
customer_reviews.text: My cat used to love these. She never hesitated to eat the tablets from my old bottle of Hairball Relief, but I got a new bottle recently and it seems that they changed the formula and the tablets look a little different. She won’t even touch the new tablets! I guess every cat is different, and some cats make like the new formula, but my cat is definitely not a fan.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Its working !!
customer_reviews.text: We have two cats and frequently had hairball problems. Since we started using the hairball relief digestive aid it appears to be working. We have one old finicky cat who at first ate them with no problem. But now he has days where he won't. Not a big problem we now make sure its the first food he gets. The cats think they are treats.
customer_reviews.author: riverbendbeck

customer_reviews.title: SO Hard, can't break or chop them apart.
customer_reviews.text: Previously bought this product, I could break the pills for my cat, this bottle is so hard I can barely split them with a knife on a cutting board. Cats can't eat them. I can't find a way to return them as the order was fulfilled by Amazon, not the manufacturer!
customer_reviews.author: F Locke

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves these again.
customer_reviews.text: I had previously rated these a five star, then changed my rating to a one star when the formula changed, since my cat had stopped eating them at that time. I received a bottle from the company asking if I would try them again and then issue another review. I agreed to do so and after trying them with my cat he LOVES them again, and on top of that, they work. Now my cat will eat them again and they work well in getting rid of the hair balls. YIpee, my cat and I are now happy again. Thanks for listening Vet's Best!
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love them... my cats wont touch them. We have to crush them an mizlx with canned food which is way more work than just going with a liquid formula. These are HUGE honestly about the size of a quarter and VERY chalky
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Falk

customer_reviews.title: HELP!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cats will not eat them now. Please change them back to the previous formula. OLD FORMULA IS STILL AVAILABLE IN THE 2 PACK.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: While I LOVE this product's paste version (me being a bit lazy) ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this brand for a number of years now (well, my cats! lol) and it certainly helped to ease their hairball issues. While I LOVE this product's paste version (me being a bit lazy) I had to accept that in the US only the tablets are available. Which means having to crumble the hard tablets into powder then sprinkle it on their foods (yeah, finicky b@st@rds!) Hope to see more of Vet's Best product range soon :)
customer_reviews.author: Beatrix

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome, my long furred kitty has terrible trouble with hairballs and this cleared them right up. I definitely recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Mark Boswell

customer_reviews.title: Changed Formula, cats not happy. As of 12/20/16 still horrible formula
customer_reviews.text: Cats won't touch the new formula. The company, Vets Best, acts like they just have no idea how the ingredients went from chicken and liver to sand and cellulose. If and when the old formula reappears I'll buy it again. Update: The company kept saying it was trying to change it back? Or whatever doubletalk they were using to convince people somehow they weren't responsible for the changes. Decided to try again, new bottle arrived 12-20-2016, and it's still horrible Different color and texture, and cats hate it.
customer_reviews.author: stumpers@swbell.net

customer_reviews.title: Used to be hard as rocks, now reformulated and easy to break up
customer_reviews.text: I'm deleting and replacing my previous review for this product. Previously, I gave it a bad review, because the tablets were much too hard. I had to actually smash them with a hammer to make them cat-edible. The company reformulated the tablets. The current version is much easier to break up, and it seems to work well. I have a very old (22!) tortie cat with long fur. I crumble one of these tablets into her wet food and add some water and stir. She eats it right up, and it has completely stopped her hairball retching. My younger (11) Siamese cat doesn't care for them, unfortunately. Two paws up from the tortie!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Weinberg

customer_reviews.title: Natural ingredients
customer_reviews.text: Two of three cats like this hairball relief. One smells it and walks away. I like how the ingredients are natural, no petroleum like the gel one, but it doesnt work as good. My cat still trying to cough up a hairball after 2 weeks of this. Will continue to use as a treat because of the ingredients. Recommended still.
customer_reviews.author: Deans

customer_reviews.title: Flavorable treat
customer_reviews.text: After a few days of twice daily treat, my cat no longer had trouble with hard poop.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Cat LOVES these pills!
customer_reviews.text: Trixie adores these tablets and she sits at her bowl just waiting for her morning and evening treats. I started out pulverizing/chopping the tablet so it would be easier for her to eat it, but now I just drop one in the bowl and she works it. Total success.
customer_reviews.author: Having Fun

customer_reviews.title: Great help and my cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I give this pill to my very furry cat twice a day and she loves it! I think it has helped in that she rarely has hairballs anymore. This product has really helped us and I'm so glad for it. The only negative is I bought this somewhere else before Amazon and the pills were a flatter disc-like product. The pills I received from Amazon were thicker and more barrel like. It's harder to break this pill up than it was the flat disc shaped one, but it's still doable. One more thing though, my very finicky cat does not touch this pill so I guess it's the luck of the draw.
customer_reviews.author: LLB

customer_reviews.title: Definitely an improvement in fewer Furballs!
customer_reviews.text: Both of my 10 year old cats (one male, one female) have shown a significant reduction in furball barfs. The tablets are scored and I cut them in smaller pieces with a paring knife. They both seem to like the taste (though I do give them snacks at the same time). I'm on autoship.
customer_reviews.author: CinInSC

customer_reviews.title: We have 3 cats that LOVED the old formula
customer_reviews.text: Agreed. We have 3 cats that LOVED the old formula, they all refuse to eat the new stuff. Sniff it and walk away like "That is not food, what are you trying to pull here." Even tried to mix some up in their wet food thinking they just didn't like a change, I've used this with other things with success. They still won't eat it. I have canceled my subscription.
customer_reviews.author: S. Burke

customer_reviews.title: My Maine Coon loves these digestive treats and has less furballs since taking them
customer_reviews.text: My Maine Coon is quite the neat freak and is constantly grooming. With that comes ingesting some fur and dreaded furballs. But since she started taking these, she has been vomiting up less furballs. And the taste seems to be great because she always makes her trilling sounds for more when she sees the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Definitely has made improvements
customer_reviews.text: This definitely has made improvements in the number of times my cat vomits hairballs. My cat had stopped eating it for a while (only due to the fact she didn't like the wet food I was mixing it in any longer), but now she has found another wet food she likes. I have started mixing 1/2 tablet twice a day. The vomiting has stopped again in the last few days! Finally, I can come home to a house that doesn't have a pile of vomit and hairball on the floor! UPDATE: I do want to make it clear that I still have the old formula bottle, so I can't speak for the new formula.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Changed the formula and it's not good!
customer_reviews.text: They changed the formula and my cats hate it. They won't eat the tablets and eat around them if I put them in their food. Very disappointed with the manufacturer because of this. They worked great on my kitties before they changed the formula!
customer_reviews.author: Beth H.

customer_reviews.title: Speckled tabs look questionable!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a subscription to these for about 5 months. This month, the tablets look different. They have darker speckles on the tabs and I’m hesitant to give them to my cat! The tab on the top is last months and what they typically look like. The tab on the bottom is this months.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Huge fur balls.
customer_reviews.text: I have a handsome, 18 lb domestic short hair gray male cat, who sheds worse then any cat I've ever had. He sheds huge quantities of fur, even after I've used the Furminator on him, a special type Brush to groom pets. And he sheds 24/7, every single day. It almost seems as if he can shed on command. Which of course results in Peanut yarking up huge disgusting fur balls. These tablets help more then anything else I've tried over the years. I've been giving Peanut these tablets for several years now, with very good results.
customer_reviews.author: AlaskaNessy

customer_reviews.title: Hope it's still OK for my cat
customer_reviews.text: Have they changed the formula? The pills are MUCH harder to break up than before. Hurts my fingers. Hope it's not hurting my cat's digestive track. He's still eating it, and it does help with the hairballs. But the broken up pieces seem to have sharp points now.
customer_reviews.author: km6

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing change in formula...turned a lover into a hater!
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: They've changed the formula on these pills and now both of my cats hate them. The consistency is thinner and the ingredients are less wholesome; it's clear the quality has been compromised. Spaghetti and Meatball are deeply disappointed and so am I! These seem to do a fine job of keeping my long-haired cat's hairball problem in check....and I certainly have no issues getting her to eat the tablets! In fact, she meows meows meows each morning and night for her dosage - she can't get enough! Her enthusiasm for her actual cat treats pales in comparison to her budding Vet's Best Digestive Aid addiction. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Yummy Tummy Cookies
customer_reviews.text: My fur babies love these little "yummy tummy cookies" as I call them. They run when they hear the bottle shake. They will usually run to their water bowl right afterwards so I imagine there's something in it that makes them thirsty. I haven't seen any hairball issues or vomiting since they started eating these. I will definitely buy another bottle or two.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Lee

customer_reviews.title: Pet delicious, Hard to break scored tablets
customer_reviews.text: Although my cat enjoys eating the broken up tablet as directed, it is very hard to break even though the tablet is scored. I have to use a pill cutter. There is no expiration date noted.
customer_reviews.author: MSG

customer_reviews.title: Changed the product, now cats HATE it
customer_reviews.text: My cats used to love these. They would try to bite my hands to get to them. Now, they changed the formula and my cats won't go near them. From other reviews, I am seeing a trend. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Here is my previous review---I have 2 foster kitties. Once we got them, we noticed that there were hairballs all over their room! I have never seen so many hairballs in my life!! We bought this product and have seen a remarkable reduction. Now we hardly ever see a hairball, It's amazing! The cats love the flavor so much that they actually beg for the "treat". Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor.  Works great
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a normal hairball food. It works great as the food didnt clear up all the hairballs in one of my cats. He has a ton of fur. N he loves to groom himself. My cat loves the flavor. I never had tobreak it up to give it to him
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Cats who won't eat hairball pastes like this product
customer_reviews.text: I have always used paste or gel type hairball products until this batch of cats. They refused to eat the gel even salmon or tuna. If I placed in on their paw they slung it off and created a gargantuan mess I had to hunt down to clean. But all three will eat these tablets as treats and it greatly reduces hairballs and regurgitated hair messes.
customer_reviews.author: RJG

customer_reviews.title: Why spoil an excellent product?
customer_reviews.text: Have been purchasing this item for a long time and my cat has begged for them each morning. He still begs for them, but now sniffs and turns away. Here I am w/several backup bottles of this product and my cat won't touch them. Something is definitely different in the formulary. Pills are very hard and I can barely cut through them w/a knife. Not a happy camper, nor is my cat!
customer_reviews.author: cagrammy

customer_reviews.title: No more hairballs!
customer_reviews.text: My short hair cat was hacking up hairballs several times a week before I found these on Amazon. After reading some helpful reviews I decided to give these a try. I am so happy that I did! My first thoughts when I opened these were... Is my cat going to even eat these chalky looking tablets? They are scored down the middle and easily broke in half. I then broke the half in to smaller peaces. My cat Loves these! The best part ... She has not hacked up a single hair ball since she started using these two months ago! These are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: G Man

customer_reviews.title: Might take a bit of calibration, but it works for me
customer_reviews.text: My cat is 13 years old and can't digest like he used to. After a year of escalating hairballs, I had to start brushing him. This helped, but only so much. I turned to supplements. I've tried several, but this is the only one that seems to make any difference. At full dosage, it would give him diarrhea. I scaled it back to half dosage and it seems to work perfectly. With no external help, he would get 2-3 hairballs per week. With brushing alone, he would get 1 hairball per week. With brushing and this supplement, I'm going on 3 months with zero hairballs. For what it is worth, he is on a 100% wet food diet.
customer_reviews.author: mbrennan

customer_reviews.title: Gave my cat weird symptoms
customer_reviews.text: My cat started acting weird a few days after I gave this to him. He became clumsy, like falling asleep somewhere sitting up and then toppling over. It came out of nowhere. He started hiding under the bed too.So I stopped giving this to him and all the weird symptoms disappeared. Now it could've been coincidence but i don't think SO. Maybe it was just something with my cat. Just saying, keep an eye out for any weird symptoms--could be certain cats don't tolerate this at all.
customer_reviews.author: S. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Decent formula, but not well though out... gotta be something better out there.
customer_reviews.text: 2 cats, one with hairballs and one without... unfortunately my cat with hairballs wouldn't eat them, but my cat that didn't have hairballs would. I took the whole bottle and threw it in the blender... twice a week I sprinkle this on the cat's food, and I gave this product 3 stars because it does work, but next time, I'll be buying something that is in treat form (like something chewy)... there has to be something that cats will eat that works out there. Even my other cat wouldn't eat these until they were broken up a bit. Breaking them is in the directions, but why don't them just make them 4 times smaller??? Would that have been so hard.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Gemmer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Our cat was having trouble with some hair getting stuck in her throat. We are a bit lucky because she hates actually coughing up anything and will do almost anything to avoid it, but because of this she couldn't get the stuck fur to go away. After we started giving her these she had gotten so much better. She can purr and meow again and is much happier. She also loves the taste of these and runs to the kitchen whenever she hears us grab the bottle. I will continue to buy these and give them to her at least a few times a week.
customer_reviews.author: B2727

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Live This
customer_reviews.text: My cats think it's a cat treat! They hover around me morning and evening waiting for me to open the bottle and dispense with their "treat"! I'm not sure if it helps or not because I have to give it to them every day.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J.

customer_reviews.title: I hate to leave a review without getting a chance to ...
customer_reviews.text: I hate to leave a review without getting a chance to see if the tables are actually effective. But I think buyers should take note that these are very large. There is a photo showing this but even splitting it in half was too big for my cats. Also they kind of crumbled when I tried to break them apart. Just a heads up they are kind of a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: RachLab18

product_meta.title: Vet's Best Cat Hairball Relief Digestive Aid| Vet Formulated Hairball Support Remedy | Classic Chicken Flavor
product_meta.description: Size:60 TabletsPrevent hairballs and support healthy digestion for the finickiest felines with Vet's Best Cat Hairball Relief Digestive Aid. They will love our classic chicken flavor recipe; you will love not having to clean up after them. Formulated by veterinarians and loved by cats.
feature_bullets: CLASSIC CHICKEN FLAVOR - Our classic chicken flavor is a favorite among felines and provides safe support for a healthy digestive system while helping to prevent hairballs.
CONVENIENT DAILY CHEWABLE - These tablets can be hand fed daily as a treat or given with meals.

VET FORMULATED - Vet's Best Hairball Relief is veterinarian formulated with a blend of plant-based ingredients, including apple fiber, papaya extract, psyllium seed, marshmallow root and slippery elm.
QUALITY - Each bottle of Vet's Best Hairball Relief carries the National Animal Supplement Council (NASC) Quality Seal.
SUPPORTS HEALTHY DIGESTION - Vet's Best Hairball Relief for cats supports normal and healthy digestion.
